title: Fix DevlogList TypeScript Errors and Improve FilterType System
description: Fix multiple TypeScript compilation errors in DevlogList.tsx related to CSS inline styles, add proper typing for status categories (open/closed) in FilterType system, and fix usability issue where stats refresh unnecessarily when selecting total/open/closed filters.

notes.content:
Completed: Successfully resolved all three issues:

## âœ… Issue 1: TypeScript Errors in DevlogList.tsx
**Fixed**: Replaced all inline CSS styles with proper CSS classes in DevlogList.module.css:
- Added `searchDropdownMenu`, `searchDropdownInputContainer`, `searchDropdownActions` classes
- Added `batchActionsToolbar`, `batchDeleteList`, `batchDeleteItem` classes  
- All TypeScript compilation errors resolved

## âœ… Issue 2: Missing Types for Status Categories
**Fixed**: Added proper FilterType definition to core types system:
- Added `FilterType = DevlogStatus | 'total' | 'open' | 'closed'` to core/types/core.ts
- Updated useDevlogFilters and OverviewStats to import FilterType from @devlog/core
- Removed duplicate local FilterType definitions for centralized typing

## âœ… Issue 3: Unnecessary Stats Refresh on Filtering
**Fixed**: Separated stats management from filtering to prevent unnecessary API calls:
- Modified useStats hook to only fetch once on mount (removed dependencies parameter)
- Stats now represent overall system state, not filtered view
- Stats only refresh on actual CRUD operations (create, update, delete)
- Added smart refresh logic: stats refetch after delete/batch operations and on page visibility change

- **FilterType System**: Proper typing throughout codebase âœ…

**Technical Approach**: 
- Server-side filtering maintained for efficiency (no client-side data loading)
- Stats calculated server-side and cached until actual data changes
- Proper separation of concerns: filtering affects data view, stats represent system state

context.businessContext: These issues affect developer experience and user experience. TypeScript errors block builds and proper typing prevents runtime errors. The unnecessary stats refresh creates poor UX when users are simply filtering data.
context.technicalContext: DevlogList.tsx has CSS inline style violations. FilterType currently supports 'open'/'closed' but they lack proper typing integration. Stats component refreshes data on every filter change, which is unnecessary for client-side filtering.
acceptanceCriteria: All TypeScript compilation errors in DevlogList.tsx are resolved
FilterType has proper TypeScript definitions for 'open' and 'closed' categories
Stats component does not refresh when selecting total/open/closed filters
